question_text: Which of the following accurately describe the DHCP DORA process? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: A client sends a Discover broadcast to locate a server
The server responds with an Offer including IP and configuration
The client replies with a Request to accept the offered lease
The server confirms assignment with an Acknowledge message
The Acknowledge contains DNS settings and encryption keys
correct_answer: A client sends a Discover broadcast to locate a server
The server responds with an Offer including IP and configuration
The client replies with a Request to accept the offered lease
The server confirms assignment with an Acknowledge message
explanation: DORA consists of Discover, Offer, Request, and Acknowledge â€” a 4-step process used for dynamic IP assignment.
